Application of AI Security and Surveillance

One use of AI in the industry is with facial recognition software. These programs are varied in their usesâ€”some just recognizing faces in general, others bookmarking moments when faces appear in long security tapes so humans only have to look through a few minutes of footage for perpetrators of a crime instead of multiple hours or even days. This means these people can divert their attention to other, more important places.

Another use of AI facial recognition software is biometrics. Biometrics is the use of unique physical characteristics (like a face or fingerprints) to verify your identity, basically letting you have a very complex personal passkey with you at all times. Many companies are opting to use these instead of short passkeys, like with Apple's Face ID and how many banking apps let you substitute a facial scan for your PIN.

While this application of AI is widely seen as beneficial for its innovation and ease of use, there is a dark side. In many cases, companies use this software to secretly breach your privacy and steal your facial data or pictures of your face for training future AIs. On top of that, many people see this as "the end of anonymity" if governments get their hands on this data and use these systems, because no matter what you are doing, as long as they get a picture of you, they can identify you instantly and you lose all the privacy you had.
